channel.title: games on The Work Item
channel.description: Recent content in games on The Work Item

item.title: S01E16 - Bill Kenney on Building Brands That Last
item.description: This weekend, we go outdoors with Bill Kenney, co-founder of Focus Lab, a branding agency that is entirely remote. We talk to Bill about the importance of a good brand and what distinguishes professionals from amateurs in the field. This also happens to be the the first time we chat to a person that knows the ins and outs of branding, so lessons learned all around.

item.title: S01E15 - Tarun Gangwani on Innovation, Navigating Product Decisions, and Building Growth Engines
item.description: We sit down to chat with Tarun Gangwani, Senior Product Manager at Sanity.io. Tarun is a seasoned PM with tons of expertise to share about the product management domain. With previous experience at Twitch, where he oversaw the entire lifecycle of a developer using extensions and data services to create engaging and personalized viewing and streaming experiences, Tarun is talking about lessons learned, differences between startup and large company environments, along with the ways in which product managers can broaden the understanding of their products and customer needs.

item.title: S01E14 - Interview with Richard Lander
item.description:
In this episode of The Work Item we interview Richard Lander, Principal Program Manager on the .NET team at Microsoft. Richard does a deep dive on communication, being a generalist vs. specialist, and growing one’s career.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Richard on Twitter: https://twitter.com/runfaster2000 Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E13 - Interview with Amanda Silver
item.description:
In this episode of The Work Item we interview Amanda Silver, Corporate Vice President, Developer Division at Microsoft. We discuss the process of building great developer tools, the human element in product design, and career advice for the long run.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Amanda on Twitter: https://twitter.com/amandaksilver Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E12 - Interview with Christina Weng
item.description:
In this episode of The Work Item we interview Christina Weng, product designer at Facebook, about building a career in user experience design from scratch.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Christina on her blog: https://christinaweng.com Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E11 - Interview with Eric Martel
item.description:
We’re back after a week-long hiatus with an interview. This time, we chat with Eric Martel, Director of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at Eidos-Montr√©al. We re-visit some of the gream games of the past, talk about console development considerations for modern games, and dig into how artificial intelligence and machine learning are going to revolutionize the engineering process.
You can also listen to the audio directly:

item.title: S01E10 - Interview with Sara Chipps
item.description: In this episode of The Work Item, we interview Sara Chipps, Director of Public Q&A at Stack Overflow. Sara is also the founder of JewelBots, a company that provides electronic building kits for young inventors. We chat with Sara about community feedback, engineering management career tracks, and building tools for STEM inclusivity. You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Sara on the following sites:

item.title: S01E09 - Interview with Philipp Cannons
item.description: In this episode of The Work Item, we interview Philipp Cannons, CEO and founder of PMFIT.AI - a startup that aims to accelerate product success. Philipp talks about his experience starting a business from scratch and building a deep understanding of large organizations. You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Philipp on the following sites: Twitter Blog Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E08 - Interview with Charmaine Lee
item.description: In this episode of The Work Item, we interview Charmaine Lee, product manager intern at Microsoft, and a friend of the show. Charmaine talks about her experiences breaking into tech, building projects for fun, and being engaged in local tech scenes. You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Charmaine on the following sites: Twitter Blog Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E07 - Interview with Dan Fernandez
item.description: In this episode of The Work Item, we interview Dan Fernandez, VP of Product for Developer Services at Salesforce. Dan, a tech veteran, talks about product management, skill stacking, and building great developer experiences. You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Dan on the following sites: Twitter Blog And if you’re curious about the archived blog post that we mentioned on the show where Dan is blonde, it’s still online!

item.title: S01E06 - Interview with Matt Swanson
item.description:
Today, we had the honor of having an in-depth conversation with Matt Swanson, a software engineer at SEP, on engineering best practices, design systems, and managing complexity.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Matt on the following sites: Twitter GitHub Blog And of course, we couldn’t wrap up this post without giving a shout-out to Matt’s project - Boring Rails.

item.title: S01E05 - Interview with Jin Yang
item.description:
A virtual fireside chat with Jin Yang, VP of design at CapitalOne. We discuss leadership, building great teams, and wrap up the show with food place recommendations.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Jin on social media: Twitter Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E04 - Interview with Clint Rutkas
item.description:
In this episode, Courtny Cotten and Den Delimarsky chat with Clint Rutkas about PowerToys - a fantastic set of utilities for Windows power users.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find Clint on the following Internet locations: Twitter GitHub Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E03 - Interview with April Speight
item.description:
In this episode, Courtny Cotten and Den Delimarsky chat with April Speight, Senior Developer Advocate at Microsoft, about social media, writing Python books for kids and more.
You can also listen to the audio directly: You can find April on the following Internet locations: Twitter Twitch YouTube Her blog GitHub Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts, Google Play Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E02 - Career Starts
item.description:
What is it like to start as a designer or a product manager? In this episode, Courtny and Den talk about their own journey in the tech industry, from the very early days!
You can also listen to the audio directly: Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts and Spotify.

item.title: S01E01 - Remote Work
item.description:
Have you ever wondered what it’s like to work away from a tall office building in a large metropolis? Courtny and Den dive into this topic and more!
You can also listen to the audio directly: Check this episode out on Apple Podcasts and Spotify.
